snippet: The splintering is a sign of growing concerns, among even staunch conservatives like the billionaire brothers Charles and David Koch, that the strategy of taking on health care at any cost may have backfired.
abstract: Some of the most vocal elements of Republican Party's conservative wing are publicly splintering under attack for the government shutdown, a sign of growing concerns, among even hard-core conservatives like billionaire brothers Charles and David Koch, that the defeat-health-care-at-any-cost strategy may have backfired.

byline.original: By ERIC LIPTON and NICHOLAS CONFESSORE
byline.contributor: Eric Lipton reported from Washington, and Nicholas Confessore from New York.

lead_paragraph: The splintering is a sign of growing concerns, among even staunch conservatives like the billionaire brothers Charles and David Koch, that the strategy of taking on health care at any cost may have backfired.

headline.main: Kochs and Other Conservatives Split Over Strategy on Health Law
headline.print_headline: Kochs and Other Conservatives Split Over Strategy on Health Law

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
keywords.name: subject
